oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Antimalarial activity of 3-hydroxyalkyl-2-methylenepropionic acid derivatives
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUNDU, MK
SUNDAR, N
KUMAR, SK
BHAT, SV
BISWAS, S
VALECHA, N
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: baylis-hillman reaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Several Baylis-Hillman adducts and their derivatives were synthesized and evaluated as targeted potential anti-malarials, The compounds 4, 7 and 9 were found to have highest potency against P. falciparum in vitro. The in vivo test result of compound 4 and 9 against P. berghei demonstrated activity at 80 mg/Kg dose level. (C) 1999 . .
